name: EuroSpa & Inn

reviews.text: This was a great stop on our way through Napa. My family stayed in other rooms as well so I got a good look at this place. The pool area is behind the property and quiet. The patio area out front for all the patrons is perfect for relaxing with your wine and cheese or breakfast and newspapers. The rooms are cozy but provide everything you need including wine glasses and refrigerator. The only downside I found was that our bed was fairly uncomfortable, they would definitely benefit from some cushy mattress covers. My uncle stayed in room #12 which closest to the patio area and he said he could hear everyone in the morning while they were eating breakfast and he was trying to sleep. Other than that I can find no problems with the service, location or in general. We walked to dinner (2 blocks) and ate at a great Mexican place called Pacifico and it was tasty. Oh and we loved that we had a deep, jetted tub in our standard room!
reviews.title: Great Location and Relaxing Atmosphere

likes.liked: — The Quiet, the great service, the privacy, the close location to main street
likes.disliked: — The bed but some others in my party said there beds were fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is much more than just another motel - the room was beautifully decorated and well furnished, such that you felt like you were in a hotel. Although we had originally planned to stay for only two nights, we were pleased that we had needed to change our plans and stay four nights instead. Unlike the other motels we had stayed in, this felt homely. It was also very conveniently located a couple of blocks away from the main street in Calistoga, which meant that our short evening stroll to the restaurants was through a pleasant residential area (bring a torch - there aren't many streetlights!!).
reviews.title: A real gem

likes.liked: — Exceeded our expectations of what a motel could be like

reviews.text: The bathroom had it's own jacuzzi bath, which was in addition to the outdoor jacuzzi and heated swimming pool. The pool area provides a place to relax within an enclosed garden, and is well maintained.
reviews.title: Great Breakfast, Clean Pool, Short walk to town

likes.disliked: — Ok.... it would be nice if the cars were tucked away somewhere else than in the courtyard.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts were varied and plentiful, and the late afternoon snacks and refreshments were welcomed after a day out exploring the local area.
reviews.title: Oct 2006 - Great place, great location

likes.liked: — spa and proximity to downtown Calistoga
likes.disliked: — room size was a little small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reconditioned Motel with drive in courtyard which may be an issue for some people used to proper parking lots off in the distance. Frankly, I was concerned until I got to experience the property and ended up deciding the parking courtyard was part of its charm in a retro sort of way.
reviews.title: The Relaxing EuroSpa

likes.liked: — We liked the easy-going, relaxed atmosphere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very cozy hotel and spa located at the north end of wine country. It is worth the extra drive as you pass through very scenic areas and get to drive through the heart of wine country.
reviews.title: Cozy Inn

reviews.text: This hotel is exactly what their website said it would be. Very cozy, very clean and a friendly staff. My wife and I booked the romantic package and it is worth the money spent. The dinner at Brannons was excellent and the room is nice sized with an oversized bathroom. The spa is no frills but the staff is courteous and attentive. Definitely worth the extra drive from the San Francisco Airport. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Suprising find

likes.disliked: — Close parking was both a plus(convienent) and a minus (noise)

reviews.text: We were recommended to this hotel by the Best Western Calistoga manager who was unable to accomodate us when we decided to end our day in Calistoga. After discovering we could get a 2 room suite to accomodate our family with younger children for $115 and included breakfast on outdoor patio we decided to give it a try. We were pleasantly suprised with the nice decor, updated and clean accomodations after pulling up to an unimpressive small motor lodge looking place. Our unit had fireplace, refrigerator, microwave, king bed and a queen bed with tv in its own room as well as a whirlpool jet bath and separate shower all decorated in pottery barn style furnishings. Bathrobes and great smelling bath products provided. Kids enjoyed a small pool/spa out back which was heated to their liking despite air temps in the 60s. Breakfast on patio was pleasant and filling and comprehensive with excellent blueberry muffins. Convenient parking right outside your unit with no stairs to climb although did notice noise from others packing up in the morning. Super value for the price and very comfortable. Front desk provided excellent suggestions for dinner all within walking distance.
reviews.title: Quaint, Clean and Affordable!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked two rooms over the internet with another couple. Always a bit weary of if the place will actually be what it looks like online - the Euro Spa was just as cute as we had hoped. We were looking for an affordable and clean option in the Napa area that provided a good location to wineries and restaurants while still offering up some wine country charm.
reviews.title: Nice value, great location

reviews.text: The Euro Spa has a continental breakfast that made mornings easy - but also fun as we sat outside and enjoyed the courtyard. They also provide a "happy hour" of sorts from 4-6pm that was a perfect thing to come back "home" to after a day of touring.
reviews.title: Excellent value for girls' weekend
Wonderful Place
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Eurospa and Inn with my two sons and my girlfriend. It was nice and quaint and comfortable. We enjoyed our stay thoroughly. The daily cleaning service with fresh towels and robes were great and the continental breakfast was nice as well. We did not take any spa services but the stay itself was nice. We were lucky to get a manager's special so i feel that it was well worth it. Had we had to pay regular price of 180+ I would feel the charge would be too high. Overall it was good.

We loved staying at the Euro Spa & Inn with our family and friends. We came up to Calistoga to run a half marathon at Napa/Bothe State Park, which is absolutely beautiful and only about 10 minutes from the inn.
reviews.title: Loved the Euro Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very kind and helpful, offering us ideas for dinner and also coupons for several nearby restaurants! The property is within walking distance of the shops and cafes, which was great!
reviews.title: A beautiful Place.. excellent location!

likes.liked: — The friendly staff and the cleanliness of the rooms!

reviews.title: Perfect place for our wedding weekend!
reviews.text: We loved our rooms...very quaint and cozy. The fireplace was a definite bonus, along with the large jacuzzi bathtub! The complimentary breakfast is much larger than most, with lots of yummy options and great coffee!

reviews.title: Perfect Gal-Pal Getaway Weekend @ EuroSpa in Calistoga
reviews.text: The pool and outdoor hot tub were very clean and backed up to a beautiful view of the vineyards and mountains. Didn't try any of the spa services, but the atmosphere looked very nice and relaxing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A most pleasant and laid-back stay for 3 nts here...perfect location to wonderful wineries, restaurants. Our room was spacious and very clean. We loved that the quaint town of Calistoga was just a short walk...some cool stores and restaurants...Calistoga Inn was superb!
reviews.title: Highly Recommend!

reviews.text: I just got back from a 2 night stay at the Euro Spa and Inn for a girlfriends' getaway weekend. The three of us stayed in two roooms and got treatments at the Spa.
reviews.title: Loved the Inn; Get Your Massage Elsewhere

likes.liked: — Close to town, clean rooms, free food
likes.disliked: — The Spa Service, garbage truck coming at 6am,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will start off the with the hotel itself- it was great! The rooms were clean, cozy, and each had the convenience of a mini-kitchen and robes. Each morning there was a continental breakfast on the patio and every afternoon there are afternoon snacks (cookies, cheese, crackers, fruit) to hold you over until dinner. The spa and pool (not so heated) were clean and relaxing.
reviews.title: Quiet, peaceful stay

likes.disliked: — Little distant from center of Napa Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now for the Spa service- we looked into every spa in the area before booking here, mainly for the convenience of getting our treatments where we were staying despite the fact that the Spa packages weren't the best value (and they didn't give us much of a discount though between the three of us getting 3 treatments, you'd think they would have).
reviews.title: EuroSpa & Inn is as good as it gets in Northern California

likes.disliked: — We couldn't get more time, but that was lack of planning on our part.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two of us requested a male masseuse, while one of us requested a female. The two of us who had the male masseuse were very disappointed to say the least with our service for a couple of reasons. 1) The Masseuse: he looked very 'unkempt" and looked like he belonged in a grunge music band (pulling his hair back in a pony tail might have at least made him appear more professional. He was also very stingy with the massage oil-at first I didn't realize he was even using any. The massage and foot "reflexology" treatment (not worth $65!) were average. 2) The Room itself: NO music during the treatment which made it very awkward, the room was freezing (no heated bed), no curtain over the window and the sun was beaming into the window, even when I was laying on my stomach it was very bright, and the room was about 3 steps away from the reception desk, so I heard the receptionist coughing the entire time, all of her phone conversations (she didn't attempt to whisper during the phone calls), the register ringing, toilet flushing, the traffic from the main road about a tenth of a mile from the spa, and just about everything else you would NOT want to hear during a "relaxing" massage. Our friend who had the female massage therapist thoroughly enjoyed her massage, and she also had a room farther away from the main area where we were.
reviews.title: Great motel/hotel/spa

likes.disliked: — afternoon wine was poor quality for the Valley

description: Euro Spa & Inn in Calistoga, California features 13 deluxe, boutique-style hotel guestrooms, complimentary breakfast, whirlpool tubs, gas woodstove fireplaces, onsite spa, and a variety of wine country Calistoga vacation packages for a unique Calistoga wine county lodging experience.
